title: Augusta County: Tony Pastor to Annie Harris, April 9, 1861
summary: Pastor writes that the Governor has replaced many of the higher officers with appointments, hurting troop morale. Tony himself is sick, but only with a cold, and he is on the mend. He writes that he hopes a home guard has been organized to protect the women of Augusta.
keywords: Military Authority, State Government, Medicine/Hospitals, Camp Life, Women, Home Front, American Civil War
